title: Applying Probability to Real-World Problems
body: United Blood Services is a blood bank that serves more than $$500$$ hospitals in $$18$$ states. According to their website, a person with type O blood and a negative Rh factor $$(Rh-)$$ can donate blood to any person with any blood type. Their data show that 43% of people have type O blood and 15% of people have Rh- factor; 52% of people have type O or Rh- factor. Let O $$=$$ a person with type O blood and R $$=$$ a person with a negative Rh factor $$(Rh-)$$.
